alert.note: Alert for East Slopes of the Washington Cascades (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued November 05 at 3:43AM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...HEAVY RAINFALL THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON WILL CAUSE RISING WATERS ALONG THE YAKIMA RIVER... An Atmospheric River will produce moderate to heavy precipitation across the east slopes of the Washington Cascades through this afternoon. Total liquid precipitation amounts through 5 PM PDT today ranging from 0.15 to 0.25 inches are expected along the foothills. Total amounts ranging from 0.25 to 0.75 inches are expected in the mountains with locally heavy amounts nearing 1.00 inches. This will lead to rises on rivers, with the Yakima at Easton expected to crest at around action stage between 50.0-50.5 feet this evening. This will cause areas of minor flooding to be possible along the already saturated region. Please monitor the latest river forecasts from the National Weather Service for additional information.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes of the Washington Cascades
